IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF ECHO HORIZON SCHOOL AND ITS ECHO CENTER IS TO EDUCATE CHILDREN IN A COLLABORATIVE ENVIRONMENT THAT IS ACADEMICALLY CHALLENGING AND DEVELOPMENTALLY APPROPRIATE. WE ACTIVELY PROMOTE MUTUAL RESPECT, INDIVIDUAL RESPONSIBILITY, AND ETHICAL ACTION. THE ECHO HORIZON GRADUATE IS AN INQUISITIVE AND CRITICAL THINKER WHO BRINGS CREATIVITY, KINDNESS AND SELF-RELIANCE TO THE LIFE-LONG JOURNEY OF LEARNING.
IRS990.Desc: ECHO FOUNDATION (THE ORGANIZATION) IS A NONPROFIT CORPORATION INCORPORATED IN THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA. THE ORGANIZATION WAS FOUNDED IN 1970. THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES THE ECHO HORIZON SCHOOL FOR GRADES PRE-KINDERGARTEN THROUGH SIXTH IN CULVER CITY, CALIFORNIA. ECHO SERVICED 181 STUDENTS DURING FY 22/23.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES PROVIDE ACCOUNTING AND DISCLOSURE GUIDANCE ABOUT POSITIONS TAKEN BY AN ORGANIZATION IN ITS TAX RETURNS THAT MIGHT BE UNCERTAIN. THE ORGANIZATION RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF THOSE POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT OF BEING SUSTAINED. MANAGEMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT BELIEVE THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS INCLUDE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS.
RENTAL PROPERTY DIRECT EXPENSES 17,134. SPECIAL EVENT 67,578.
RENTAL PROPERTY DIRECT EXPENSES 17,134. SPECIAL EVENT 67,578.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: EXPLANATION FOR PART XI AND XII
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ON THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, THE SCHOLARSHIP SUPPORT OF $928,230 IS NETTED AGAINST TOTAL TUITION RECEIVED. ON THE 990, THE SCHOLARSHIP SUPPORT IS PRESENTED AS ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS. DIRECT EXPENSES FOR RENT PROPERTY OF $17,134 OF DIRECT EXPENSES ARE NETTED AGAINST RENTAL PROPERTY INCOME ON THE TAX RETURN.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.NonCashAssistanceDesc: SCHOOL PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO CERTAIN INDIVIDUALS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A FORMAL AUDIT COMMITTEE MEETING IS HELD TO REVIEW AND APPROVE THE 990 PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH PERSON MUST REPORT ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST IN WHICH SUCH PERSON IS OR MAY BE INVOLVED WITH THE CHAIR, IF A TRUSTEE, OR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, IF AN EMPLOYEE. THE CHAIR OR HEAD OF SCHOOL WILL DETERMINE HOW THE CONFLICT WILL BE RESOLVED. ON AN ANNUAL BASIS, THE HEAD OF SCHOOL WILL PROVIDE THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WITH A LIST OF EMPLOYEES WHO HAVE RECEIVED GIFTS THAT EXCEED $100. ANY TRUSTEE, ADMINISTRATOR, EMPLOYEE, OR OTHER REPRESENTATIVE WHO DISCOVERS ANY BREACH OF THIS POLICY MUST IMMEDIATELY ADVISE THE CHAIR (FOR TRUSTEES) OR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL (FOR EMPLOYEES) OF ALL PERTINENT DETAILS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: KEY EMPLOYEES AND TOP MANAGEMENT RECEIVE ANNUAL PERFORMANCE REVIEWS. COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED USING COMPARABLE SALARY INFORMATION, SUCH AS SALARY SURVEYS AND IRS FORMS 990 FROM SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL INFORMATION PERTAINING TO OUR ORGANIZATION WILL BE PROVIDED UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.
THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES MEET FORMALLY TO REVIEW THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND APPROVE THE FINAL ISSUANCE. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
